description: A 4-task demo pack showcasing each scoring method: f1 (summarization), exact_match (classification), contains (code fix), and llm_judge (delivery route optimization).

tasks.description: Summarize the following news article into 3 bullet points
tasks.instruction: Read the news article and extract key information into a concise summary. Include numbers and proper nouns accurately.

examples.input: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government announced on the 15th that the number of new COVID-19 cases in the capital decreased by 20% compared to the previous week. A metropolitan official analyzed that 'the effects of vaccination are showing.' However, they also stated the need to continue monitoring variant strains. Hospital bed occupancy rates have been hovering in the 40% range, and the number of severe cases is also on a declining trend. The metropolitan government continues to urge thorough adherence to basic infection prevention measures.
examples.output: COVID cases down 20%, vaccine effect, variant monitoring, bed occupancy 40%, severe cases declining

examples.input: Major automaker Company A announced today that it will raise its electric vehicle (EV) sales target for fiscal year 2025 to 500,000 units, double the previous goal. The company's president expressed enthusiasm at a press conference, stating 'We will accelerate the transition to a decarbonized society.' The company plans to make 500 billion yen in new capital investment to expand production facilities both domestically and internationally. It also revealed that it will move up the start of mass production of all-solid-state batteries to 2026.
examples.output: EV sales 500,000 units, decarbonization, 500 billion yen capital investment, all-solid-state batteries 2026

examples.input: The Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology announced that the adoption rate of digital textbooks in elementary and junior high schools nationwide has exceeded 80%. Adoption has rapidly expanded in the three years since introduction began in fiscal year 2021. While teachers have praised that 'classes utilizing video and audio have become possible,' there are also concerns that 'dealing with device malfunctions remains a challenge.' The ministry aims to complete adoption at all schools by fiscal year 2026.
examples.output: Digital textbooks 80%, video and audio utilization, device malfunctions, fiscal year 2026 full adoption

examples.input: The Bank of Japan decided at its monetary policy meeting to raise the short-term interest rate target to 0.25%. This marks the first rate hike in approximately 17 years. Governor Ueda explained that 'a virtuous cycle of prices and wages has been confirmed.' Markets saw a stronger yen and weaker stock prices. Regarding further rate increases, he stated that 'decisions will be made based on the data.'
examples.output: BOJ rate hike 0.25%, first in 17 years, price-wage cycle, stronger yen weaker stocks

examples.input: The Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications announced that internet usage rates exceeded 90% across all age groups in 2024. Usage rates surged particularly among the elderly aged 70 and over, with the spread of online medical consultations and online shopping advancing. Meanwhile, cybercrime victimization including phishing scams is also on the rise, making the strengthening of security education a pressing issue.
examples.output: Internet usage 90%, elderly surge, online medical consultations, phishing scams, security education

examples.input: The Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry announced that it will invest a total of 2 trillion yen in subsidies as a domestic semiconductor industry support measure. The plan involves attracting new manufacturing facilities to Kumamoto Prefecture and Hokkaido, aiming to triple domestic production capacity by 2030. The main objectives are to reduce the risks of overseas dependence and strengthen economic security.
examples.output: Semiconductor support 2 trillion yen, Kumamoto, Hokkaido, 2030, production capacity tripled, economic security

examples.input: The Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries announced that the 2024 rice crop index reached a national average of 102, indicating a good harvest. Results were particularly favorable in Hokkaido and the Tohoku region. However, there are concerns about falling rice prices, and the government is considering increasing reserve rice purchases as a support measure for farmers. Consumers can expect price stability.
examples.output: Rice crop index 102, good harvest, Hokkaido, Tohoku, falling rice prices, reserve rice, price stability

examples.input: The Japan Tourism Agency announced that the number of inbound foreign tourists in 2024 surpassed the record high of 40 million. The weak yen and increased new flight routes were the main contributing factors. In addition to Tokyo and Kyoto, dispersion to regional cities is also progressing. Meanwhile, the number of municipalities considering measures against overtourism, such as admission restrictions during peak times and the introduction of tourism taxes, is increasing.
examples.output: Inbound tourists 40 million, record high, weak yen, regional dispersion, overtourism, tourism tax

test_cases.input: The Ministry of the Environment announced that domestic renewable energy power generation reached a record high in 2024. A significant increase in solar power generation capacity was the main factor. Large-scale solar power plants began operations one after another, particularly in Hokkaido and Kyushu. Meanwhile, the issue that power grid infrastructure development has not kept pace was also pointed out. The government has set a target of raising the renewable energy ratio to 40% or more by 2030.
test_cases.expected_output: Renewable energy record high, solar power, Hokkaido, Kyushu, power grid, 2030, 40%

test_cases.input: The Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare announced that the number of births in 2024 is expected to fall below 700,000, a record low. The decline in the number of marriages and later marriages were cited as the main factors. As measures against the declining birthrate, the government is expanding child allowances and improving parental leave systems. Experts have also voiced that 'in addition to financial support, work-style reform is necessary.'
test_cases.expected_output: Births below 700,000, record low, declining marriages, later marriages, child allowances, parental leave, work-style reform

test_cases.input: The Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism announced that it will begin trial introduction of dedicated lanes for autonomous vehicles on expressways starting in 2027. The plan will start on a section of the Tomei Expressway and gradually expand. It will be limited to Level 4 autonomous vehicles, which will be permitted to travel at 100 km/h. To ensure safety, high-precision road-to-vehicle communication systems will be installed in the dedicated lanes. Automakers are also accelerating the development of compatible vehicles.
test_cases.expected_output: Autonomous driving, dedicated lanes, 2027, Tomei Expressway, Level 4, 100 km/h, road-to-vehicle communication

distractors.input: Today's weather is sunny. Rain is forecast for tomorrow. The weekend will be cloudy.
My hobby is reading. Lately I've been reading a lot of historical novels. My favorite author is Ryotaro Shiba.
distractors.output: Hobby, reading, historical novels, Ryotaro Shiba

tasks.description: Classify the following inquiry into the appropriate category. Categories are: Technical Support, Billing, Contract/Cancellation, Shipping/Logistics, Returns/Exchange, Account Management, Product Information, Other. Reply with the category name only
tasks.instruction: Read the inquiry and select the most appropriate category from the 8 options. Reply with the category name only, no additional explanation.

examples.input: I can't log in. No matter how many times I enter my password, I get an 'authentication error' message.
examples.output: Technical Support

examples.input: Last month's invoice includes a charge I don't recognize. I'd like to check the details.
examples.output: Billing

examples.input: I'd like to cancel my service at the end of next month. Could you tell me how to proceed?
examples.output: Contract/Cancellation

examples.input: The item I ordered still hasn't arrived. Could you tell me the delivery status?
examples.output: Shipping/Logistics

examples.input: The product I received was damaged. I'd like to request an exchange.
examples.output: Returns/Exchange

examples.input: I'd like to change the email address registered to my account.
examples.output: Account Management

examples.input: I'd like to know more about the specifications of the new product X.
examples.output: Product Information

examples.input: Do you have any case study materials about your services?
examples.output: Other

test_cases.input: The app crashes frequently. Updating to the latest version hasn't fixed the issue.
I want to reset my password, but the reset email isn't arriving at my registered email address.
If I cancel my subscription, will I get a refund for the current month that I've already paid for?
The product I purchased doesn't fit. Can I exchange it for a different size? Also, will there be a shipping fee?
I'd like to cancel my order, but it already shows as shipped.

distractors.input: What's the weather going to be like tomorrow?
I'm really glad I bought this product! Thank you so much.

tasks.description: The following Python code has a bug. Output the fixed code only, without code blocks or markdown formatting
tasks.instruction: Read the buggy Python code and output only the corrected code. Do not use markdown formatting or code blocks.

test_cases.input:
# Buggy code: function to count the number of words in a string
def count_words(text):
    words = text.split()
    return len(words) - 1

distractors.input:
# Working code: print Hello World
print("Hello, World!")

# Design issue: uses global variables
counter = 0
def increment():
    global counter
    counter += 1

tasks.description: Calculate the optimal delivery route based on the following constraints
tasks.instruction: Calculate the optimal route from the distribution center to each delivery destination, considering cost, time, and constraints. Output the route and total cost.

examples.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Tokyo Warehouse (Start at 9:00)
Destinations:
  Store A: Yokohama (Duration 40 min, 2 Packages, Receiving Hours 10:00-12:00)
  Store B: Kawasaki (Duration 30 min, 1 Package, Receiving Hours 9:00-11:00)
  Store C: Shinagawa (Duration 20 min, 3 Packages, All Day)

Travel Time:
  Tokyo -> Yokohama: 60 min
  Tokyo -> Kawasaki: 40 min
  Tokyo -> Shinagawa: 15 min
  Yokohama -> Kawasaki: 30 min
  Kawasaki -> Shinagawa: 25 min

Fuel Cost: 10 yen/min
examples.output:
[Optimal Route]
Tokyo (9:00) -> Kawasaki (Arrive 9:40, Depart 10:10) -> Yokohama (Arrive 10:40, Depart 11:20) -> Shinagawa (Arrive 11:50, Complete 12:10)

[Reasoning]
- Store B's receiving hours end at 11:00, so it is prioritized
- Yokohama can be reached within the time window via Kawasaki
- Shinagawa accepts all day, so it is last

[Total Cost]
Travel: 40+30+30=100 min -> 1000 yen
Unloading: 40+30+20=90 min
Total Duration: 190 min

examples.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Osaka Warehouse (Start at 8:00)
Destinations:
  Store X: Kobe (Duration 30 min, 5 Packages, Receiving Hours 9:00-10:00)
  Store Y: Kyoto (Duration 45 min, 2 Packages, Receiving Hours 10:00-14:00)
  Store Z: Nara (Duration 25 min, 3 Packages, Receiving Hours 8:30-9:30)

Travel Time:
  Osaka -> Kobe: 50 min
  Osaka -> Kyoto: 60 min
  Osaka -> Nara: 45 min
  Kobe -> Kyoto: 90 min
  Nara -> Kyoto: 70 min

Fuel Cost: 12 yen/min
examples.output:
[Optimal Route]
Osaka (8:00) -> Nara (Arrive 8:45, Depart 9:10) -> Via Osaka -> Kobe (Arrive 10:00, Depart 10:30) -> Kyoto (Arrive 12:00, Complete 12:45)

[Reasoning]
- Store Z (Nara) has the earliest deadline at 9:30
- Store X (Kobe) cannot be reached in time directly from Nara, so route goes via Osaka
- Store Y (Kyoto) has ample time

[Total Cost]
Travel: 45+45+50+90=230 min -> 2760 yen
Unloading: 25+30+45=100 min
Total Duration: 330 min

examples.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Nagoya Warehouse (Start at 10:00)
Destinations:
  Store P: Gifu (Duration 20 min, 2 Packages, All Day)
  Store Q: Yokkaichi (Duration 35 min, 4 Packages, Receiving Hours 11:00-13:00)
  Store R: Toyohashi (Duration 30 min, 1 Package, Receiving Hours 10:30-12:00)

Travel Time:
  Nagoya -> Gifu: 40 min
  Nagoya -> Yokkaichi: 50 min
  Nagoya -> Toyohashi: 60 min
  Gifu -> Yokkaichi: 80 min
  Toyohashi -> Yokkaichi: 90 min

Fuel Cost: 8 yen/min
examples.output:
[Optimal Route]
Nagoya (10:00) -> Toyohashi (Arrive 11:00, Depart 11:30) -> Via Nagoya -> Yokkaichi (Arrive 12:20, Depart 12:55) -> Gifu (Arrive 14:15, Complete 14:35)

[Reasoning]
- Store R (Toyohashi) has a receiving deadline of 12:00, requires attention
- Store Q (Yokkaichi) would be delayed going directly from Toyohashi, so route goes via Nagoya
- Store P (Gifu) accepts all day, so it is last

[Total Cost]
Travel: 60+60+50+40=210 min -> 1680 yen
Unloading: 30+35+20=85 min
Total Duration: 295 min

examples.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Fukuoka Warehouse (Start at 9:00)
Destinations:
  Store D: Kitakyushu (Duration 40 min, 3 Packages, Receiving Hours 9:00-17:00)
  Store E: Kurume (Duration 25 min, 2 Packages, Receiving Hours 10:00-12:00)

Travel Time:
  Fukuoka -> Kitakyushu: 70 min
  Fukuoka -> Kurume: 45 min
  Kitakyushu -> Kurume: 100 min

Fuel Cost: 15 yen/min
examples.output:
[Optimal Route]
Fukuoka (9:00) -> Kurume (Arrive 9:45, Depart 10:10) -> Via Fukuoka -> Kitakyushu (Arrive 11:25, Complete 12:05)

[Reasoning]
- Store E (Kurume) starts receiving at 10:00, so there is a short wait
- Direct Kurume -> Kitakyushu is far, so routing via Fukuoka is more efficient
- Store D accepts all day, so there is ample time

[Total Cost]
Travel: 45+45+70=160 min -> 2400 yen
Unloading: 25+40=65 min
Total Duration: 225 min

examples.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Sapporo Warehouse (Start at 8:30)
Destinations:
  Store M: Otaru (Duration 30 min, 4 Packages, Receiving Hours 9:00-11:00)
  Store N: Chitose (Duration 20 min, 2 Packages, Receiving Hours 10:00-15:00)
  Store O: Ebetsu (Duration 15 min, 1 Package, Receiving Hours 8:00-9:00)

Travel Time:
  Sapporo -> Otaru: 50 min
  Sapporo -> Chitose: 55 min
  Sapporo -> Ebetsu: 25 min
  Otaru -> Chitose: 90 min
  Ebetsu -> Otaru: 60 min

Fuel Cost: 10 yen/min
examples.output:
[Optimal Route]
Sapporo (8:30) -> Ebetsu (Arrive 8:55, Depart 9:10) -> Otaru (Arrive 10:10, Depart 10:40) -> Via Sapporo -> Chitose (Arrive 12:25, Complete 12:45)

[Reasoning]
- Store O (Ebetsu) has the earliest deadline at 9:00, so it is the top priority
- Store M (Otaru) can be reached within the 11:00 deadline via Ebetsu
- Store N (Chitose) has ample time; routing via Sapporo is shorter than going directly from Otaru

[Total Cost]
Travel: 25+60+50+55=190 min -> 1900 yen
Unloading: 15+30+20=65 min
Total Duration: 255 min

examples.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Sendai Warehouse (Start at 7:00)
Destinations:
  Store S: Yamagata (Duration 45 min, 5 Packages, Receiving Hours 8:00-10:00)
  Store T: Fukushima (Duration 35 min, 3 Packages, Receiving Hours 9:00-12:00)

Travel Time:
  Sendai -> Yamagata: 80 min
  Sendai -> Fukushima: 90 min
  Yamagata -> Fukushima: 120 min

Fuel Cost: 11 yen/min
examples.output:
[Optimal Route]
Sendai (7:00) -> Yamagata (Arrive 8:20, Depart 9:05) -> Via Sendai -> Fukushima (Arrive 10:55, Complete 11:30)

[Reasoning]
- Store S (Yamagata) has a receiving deadline of 10:00, so it is prioritized
- Yamagata -> Fukushima direct takes 120 min, which is less efficient than via Sendai (80+90=170 min), but both options allow enough time
- In this case, routing via Sendai has higher fuel cost but provides more margin for Fukushima's 12:00 deadline

[Total Cost]
Travel: 80+80+90=250 min -> 2750 yen
Unloading: 45+35=80 min
Total Duration: 330 min

distractors.input:
[Traveling Salesman Problem]
Find the shortest route to visit all 5 cities (A, B, C, D, E).
Distance matrix:
A-B:10, A-C:15, A-D:20, A-E:25
B-C:35, B-D:25, B-E:30
C-D:30, C-E:20
D-E:15
distractors.output:
Shortest route: A -> B -> D -> E -> C -> A
Total distance: 10+25+15+20+15=85

distractors.input:
[Inventory Allocation Optimization]
Deliver products from 3 warehouses to 2 stores.
Warehouse inventory: W1=100, W2=150, W3=80
Store demand: S1=180, S2=150
Transport cost (yen/unit): W1->S1:5, W1->S2:8, W2->S1:6, W2->S2:4, W3->S1:7, W3->S2:6
What is the minimum cost allocation?
distractors.output:
Optimal allocation:
W1->S1: 100 units (500 yen)
W2->S2: 150 units (600 yen)
W3->S1: 80 units (560 yen)
Total cost: 1660 yen

test_cases.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Hiroshima Warehouse (Start at 9:30)
Destinations:
  Store J: Kure (Duration 25 min, 2 Packages, Receiving Hours 10:00-11:30)
  Store K: Higashihiroshima (Duration 30 min, 3 Packages, All Day)
  Store L: Hatsukaichi (Duration 20 min, 1 Package, Receiving Hours 9:00-10:30)

Travel Time:
  Hiroshima -> Kure: 45 min
  Hiroshima -> Higashihiroshima: 40 min
  Hiroshima -> Hatsukaichi: 30 min
  Kure -> Higashihiroshima: 60 min
  Hatsukaichi -> Kure: 55 min

Fuel Cost: 9 yen/min
test_cases.expected_output: Hiroshima Hatsukaichi Kure Higashihiroshima 10:30 11:30 deadline receiving optimal route cost

test_cases.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Niigata Warehouse (Start at 8:00)
Destinations:
  Store U: Nagaoka (Duration 35 min, 4 Packages, Receiving Hours 9:00-12:00)
  Store V: Joetsu (Duration 40 min, 2 Packages, Receiving Hours 10:00-11:00)

  Niigata -> Nagaoka: 70 min
  Niigata -> Joetsu: 120 min
  Nagaoka -> Joetsu: 60 min

Fuel Cost: 12 yen/min

test_cases.input:
[Delivery Plan]
Departure: Shizuoka Warehouse (Start at 10:00)
Destinations:
  Store G: Hamamatsu (Duration 30 min, 3 Packages, Receiving Hours 11:00-14:00)
  Store H: Numazu (Duration 25 min, 2 Packages, Receiving Hours 10:30-12:00)
  Store I: Fuji (Duration 20 min, 1 Package, All Day)

Travel Time:
  Shizuoka -> Hamamatsu: 80 min
  Shizuoka -> Numazu: 50 min
  Shizuoka -> Fuji: 35 min
  Numazu -> Fuji: 20 min
  Hamamatsu -> Numazu: 100 min

Fuel Cost: 10 yen/min
test_cases.expected_output: Shizuoka Numazu Fuji Hamamatsu 12:00 deadline efficient route cost optimal
